definitions.text: a channel that carries excess water over or around a dam or other obstruction
the act of allowing a fluid to escape
a sudden drop from an upright position
examples: he had a nasty spill on the ice

definitions.text: cause or allow (a liquid substance) to run or flow from a container
flow, run or fall out and become lost
examples: The milk spilled across the floor
The wine spilled onto the table

definitions.text: cause or allow (a solid substance) to flow or run out or over
examples: spill the beans all over the table

definitions.text: pour out in drops or small quantities or as if in drops or small quantities
examples: God shed His grace on Thee
If you don't oblige me, I'll talk!
The former employee spilled all the details

definitions.text: reduce the pressure of wind on (a sail)
